page.title: 15Industry at Kemsley
page.content: Kemsley Paper Mill, owned by Bowaters, is the only major industrial development in the area and the building dominates the landscape and is the major employer. The Mill has four paper making machines and these are in constant production, 24 hours a day, with the exception of maintenance The Mill has its own power house and provides power for another Mill in Sittingbourne, it also provides the National Grid with electricity. Bowaters look after their employees and help with social and recreational facilities.However, the Mill has an affect on the people living nearby as day and night lorries thunder through the village to get to the Mill. There is always the smell associated with paper making which hangs over the village and sometimes spreads beyond into Iwade and as far as Sittingbourne
